answers.answer: Hi.A transient ischemic attack is basically a warning sign that a stroke can occur in the future and it provides the opportunity to prevent a stroke from occurring. However, based on the criteria for diagnosing a TIA, the symptoms should have resolved within 24 hours.Your symptoms might probably be more related to the cause of your TIA rather than as the after-effects of it.It would be advisable to treat any condition that might be a risk factor for stroke, including hypertension, cardiovascular disease, diabetes, hypercholesterolemia, hyperhomocysteinemia, blood disorders, sleep apnea, migraine, obesity, carotid and peripheral artery disease.What you can do is to modify your lifestyle, including smoking and drug or alcohol intake cessation, limiting intake of cholesterol, fat, and sodium, exercising regularly, eating fruits and vegetables, and maintaining a healthy weight.You should consult a physician at the earliest possible time.Good luck.

Hi,How are you feeling now?There is 10% risk for patients who have developed TIA will have stroke in next 90 days. Did you find any cause for your stroke?I feel you should check out with physician regarding your cardiac condition. If you are found to be hypertensive, then you should start on anti-hypertensive drugs. ECG, Stress test and ECHO will help in deciding your cardiac status.Lifestyle modifications are of prime importance in management of stroke and cardiac condition.Check out with cardiologist and physician ASAP.Hope this helps you.Bye.
